This property verifies that when the active-high reset signal TxReset is asserted, the lower 8 bits of ControlData are cleared to hexadecimal value h0 on the next clock cycle.

Specifically, on every positive edge of the clock signal MTxClk, and only when TxReset is not active (TxReset == 0), the property checks: if TxReset becomes asserted (TxReset == 1), then exactly one clock cycle later, ControlData[7:0] must equal 8'h0.

The property is disabled when TxReset is active (TxReset == 0), meaning no checking occurs during reset conditions.
